release.Two

Class Logic

  • java.lang.Object
    • release.Two.Logic

  • public class Logic
extends java.lang.Object
    Logic class that manipulates the monsters from the monster class. through damage and switches the monster
    Version:
    Fall 2018
    Author:
    Michelle Vu, Alex Porter, and Justin Kaukonen

    • Field Summary

      Modifier and Type Field and Description

                       int move,
                       int moveTarget)
        Calculates the damage from the move committed
        Parameters:
        moveCommitted - takes in the move stats from move object
        move - states which move it is 1 through 4
        moveTarget - indicates which team is targeted
        Returns:

      • doMove

        public void doMove(Move moveDone,
                   int moveTarget,
                   int moveNum)
        Applies the damage to a monster.
        Parameters:
        moveDone - Move to be committed
        moveTarget - Monster target of the move
        moveNum - Index of move performed

      • diceRoll

        private boolean diceRoll(int chance)
        Randomly chooses a number to determine the chance of certain moves. Having the roll be less than the chance will allow the move to hit, or be critical.
        Parameters:
        chance - of the monster of getting a hit or critical
        Returns:
        boolean whether it will hit or be critical

      • generateEnemyTeam

        public void generateEnemyTeam(int levelID)
        Generates a team of monsters to battle against the player when they are playing alone.
        Parameters:
        levelID - amount of stats that the enemy team has CHANGE THE INT PARAMETER LATER TO A STRING SO THAT THE LEVEL IS NOT DETERMINED JUST BY A NUMBER Note, levelId will be at least 4, more likely 10 sum(allStatValues) basically

      • saveGame

        public void saveGame()
        Creates a text file that contains all necessary information to continue with an already played game. This is only useful in a single player context.

      • healTeam
